“2 MICHELIN Key” from MICHELIN guide ????

We are honored to announce that The Capitol Hotel Tokyu has been awarded 2 MICHELIN Keys in the latest hotel selection by the MICHELIN Guide, marking our second consecutive year of recognition.

As one of Japan’s leading hotels, we remain committed to providing each of our guests with an experience of genuine comfort and inspiration.
We thank all our guests for their continued support and look forward to welcoming you again soon.

#TheCapitolHotelTokyu

Christmas Eve at The Peninsula Tokyo??
With warm holiday wishes, thank you for sharing this festive season with us.

The newly redesigned guest rooms evolve the warmth and quiet elegance of a private residence into a more refined sanctuary. Designed by Studio Jouin Manku, the interiors feature a soft palette of beige and green, custom-made furniture, warm wood finishes, and gently curved forms that create an open yet intimate atmosphere.?
?
As magic hour settles over Tokyo, the room becomes a calm retreat above the city.?

Paired with main dishes such as French toast and eggs Benedict, the morning unfolds in quiet indulgence.?

Looking for a festive way to celebrate the season? ?

This holiday, Peter, our Modern French restaurant on the 24th floor, welcomes you to savor the finest ingredients, from Hokkaido scallop, Blue Lobster to A5 Hida Sirloin. Subtle Japanese flavors and seasonal accents, such as yuzu and ume, add a refined touch to each dish.

Let Chef Yohan Da Costa’s creativity shape a holiday evening to remember.

Happy New Year from Park Hyatt Tokyo.? We look forward to welcoming you throughout the year ahead.?

May 2026 bring you joy, inspiration, and memorable experiences.

This festive season, each table tells a story at The Peninsula Tokyo.???

From festive modern French dining with skyline views at our rooftop restaurant Peter, to the refined Cantonese dining at Hei Fung Terrace, and the warm glow of live music and festive décor in The Lobby, every setting invites you to celebrate in your own way.

Bathed in soft natural light, The Peak Lounge & Bar is set within a soaring atrium framed by elegant bamboo greenery. In this serene and airy setting, indulge in a refined afternoon featuring seasonal sweets and exquisitely aromatic premium teas.?

Burger Nights, the irresistible mid-week menu at @maisonmarunouchi .

Choose your pick: smoky bacon, caramelised at the edges; wagyu crowned with creamy Shirokabi (bloomy rind); or spiced merguez lamb, fragrant with herbs and a kick of heat. Each is tucked into a housemade potato bun that’s fresh from the oven, bronzed and faintly sweet. Pair it with a local craft beer flight, curated exclusively for this menu, and treat yourself to a table. Reservations are available online.

Festive evenings call for champagne. New Year’s Eve calls for a little more.

The New Year’s countdown at @maisonmarunouchi Bar & Champagne Lounge gathers live jazz, free-flow champagne and wine, and an intimate celebration in the heart of the city. An evening shaped by good company, easy conversation, and beautifully crafted canapés, from Wagyu cheeseburgers to black winter truffle croque madame and desserts from our pastry team, it’s a brilliant way to meet the year to come. Join us from the link in bio.

The new year arrives with blue skies, fresh intentions, and a few new temptations.

From January 2, two favourites return to the table: the ever-popular Strawberry & Chocolate Afternoon Tea and the Strawberry & Pistachio Mille-Feuille. The ichigo theme continues in delicious style, including three striking winter strawberry cocktails.

And because some riturals deserve an encore: weekday exclusive Steak Nights and Burger Nights will keep bringing that effortless midweek buzz to @maisonmarunouchi, just as they did in 2025.

Welcome, January 2026.

A refined sake that mirrors the spirit of Japanese cuisine.
At Japanese Restaurant Suiren, savour the restaurant’s signature Daiginjo, crafted with balance and clarity. Its floral aroma, graceful acidity, and crisp dry finish perfectly complement the artistry of Japanese dishes.

#??????????? #TheCapitolHotelTokyu #??

Winter’s sweetest fixation has arrived.
 
Expect the season’s berries at their brightest, paired with decadent chocolate in @maisonmarunouchi’s Strawberry & Chocolate Afternoon Tea. Served on the stand is a vivid lineup of sweets and seasonal savouries, from a strawberry and pistachio macaron shaped like the fruit itself to a Marunouchi pulled pork burger and tiered chocolate cake, each meticulously finished by our talented pastry team. Join us in the Champagne Lounge and settle into a languid winter afternoon.

Season’s greetings from Tokyo.
 
From Festive Afternoon Tea to spiced hot chocolate at the Bar and Champagne Lounge, December arrives with a lineup of seasonal delights. As we look toward the end of the month, celebrate Christmas Day with a festive dinner designed to impress, and join us for an intimate New Year’s countdown party with free-flow champagne and exceptional canapés. For those gathering at home, our takeaway favourites—@maisonmarunouchi’s signature fried chicken, bûche de Noël, cookies, and mille-feuille—are ready to complete the holiday table.

1. BELL SAISON?Available on Christmas Day, December 25, “Bell Saison” combines sakura gin with elderflower, berries, and citrus, finished with a snow-like foam and aromatic rosemary.?It is part of our holiday cocktail series, available daily from December 24 to 31.

2. SPICED HOT CHOCOLATE?Raise a glass with our aromatic Spiced Hot Chocolate, blending spiced rum, cinnamon, star anise, nutmeg, and other warm spices.?The rich bitterness and depth of Jamaican rum harmonize beautifully with the sweetness of hot cocoa, creating a comforting drink to warm both your hands and your heart on a cold winter night.

Available: December 1 (Mon) – December 31 (Wed), 2025?Price: 3,000 JPY per glass (tax and service included)

On the hunt for Santa’s hat.

On December 1, @maisonmarunouchi’s Festive Afternoon Tea debuts with bespoke holiday tea blends, sweets shaped like Santa’s bright red hat and jewel-like baubles, and festive savouries reimagined in elegant, bite-sized form, from Marunouchi fried chicken to petite sausage rolls. A spiced carrot cake rounds out the stand with a warm note of festive cheer. A joyful collection crafted for the month ahead. 

Join us in celebrating the season from the link in bio.

Step behind the scenes of “Operation P!” ??
Have you ever wondered what it takes to make a tiny bear move on screen?

Created using traditional stop-motion techniques, every second of “Operation P!” is made from 12 to 24 individual photographs, with each scene taking hours of delicate work to create the magical world you see on screen.

We hope Pen Bear, Toy Doctor Bear, and their delightful world bring a touch of seasonal warmth and a smile to your day. ??

A short walk from The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo stands Hie Shrine, a historic sanctuary where a serene and dignified atmosphere remains, even in the heart of the city.

Passing through the grand white torii gate and climbing the stone steps, the bustle of Tokyo gently fades, giving way to a calm that naturally brings the mind back into balance.

Whether for a formal visit or a quiet pause during your travels, it is a wonderful place to reset, reflect, and breathe.

Indulge in the serene spirit of the season as  The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo presents its New Year Bonsai Exhibition from January 8 to 27.

Thoughtfully arranged bonsai displays will grace the hotel—from the entrance to the lobby and through to the restaurants—inviting you to experience gentle moments of Japanese elegance  and tranquility  throughout their stay.

During the exhibition period, we plan to offer bonsai workshops exclusively for staying guests, as well as a visit to the renowned Omiya Bonsai Village, one of Japan’s leading hubs of bonsai culture.

Bonsai represents the essence of Zen philosophy, capturing the passage of time, the cycle of nature, and a sense of harmony within a microcosm of the natural world.

We invite you to welcome the new year with a moment of calm reflection and refined beauty.

?Discover Tokyo??????????????????

Transcend your Tokyo stay into an experience etched in eternal memory.

Our Discover Tokyo accommodation package, designed to enhance your journey, features daily breakfast, complimentary transportation to premium shopping districts across the city, and hotel credit to enjoy during your stay.

Begin your morning with a relaxed breakfast at Towers or in The Club Lounge, then journey into the city by hotel car, whether for shopping or strolling, so you can follow your curiosity and explore Tokyo at your own pace.

Upon returning, unwind poolside while overlooking the urban skyline and experience moments of relaxation in the sauna and bath, gently easing you into the evening, allowing the memories of the day to settle in.

Guests staying on the Club Level enjoy additional privileges to elevate the stay even further, including curated local experience activities, five daily food presentations, and personalized check-in services.

Uncover the many facets of Tokyo you have yet to experience with Discover Tokyo.

Feel deep relaxation and comforting warmth with an immersive spa experience at The Ritz-Carlton Spa, Tokyo.

The “Eternal Warmth Ritual” is a luxurious 90-minute treatment designed to gently embrace both body and mind during the cold season.
Your journey begins with a calming foot ritual, followed by a soothing hot stone massage that delivers comforting warmth deep into the muscles. As your body gradually unwinds, your mind will also drift into a state of serene relaxation.

After the treatment, enjoy a moment of tranquility with freshly prepared matcha and traditional Japanese sweets, allowing the lingering warmth to surround you until the very end.

Indulge in a five-day-only Christmas dinner presented by Chef Oe, Head of Teppanyaki at Japanese Restaurant Hinokizaka.

Luxurious ingredients such as foie gras, spiny lobster, and abalone are carefully selected and artfully prepared, from elegant appetizers to a main course finished with freshly shaved truffles before your eyes—a truly special course designed to delight all five senses.

Each meticulously crafted dish unfolds like a story, from the first appetizer to the grand finale, gracefully adorning your Holy Night with unforgettable flavors.

This Christmas, share a quietly glowing, unforgettable culinary journey with someone special.

Event Dates:
Friday, December 19 – Sunday, December 21, and Wednesday, December 24 – Thursday, December 25, 2025

Follow along and be part of the story as we get ready to welcome you back, renewed and reimagined.

Madrid-based fashion brand Late Checkout and The Ritz-Carlton unveil the second chapter of their collaboration. Following the success of their debut collection, which included a Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity Gold award, this latest release represents a continued evolution.

Late Checkout views the hotel not merely as a place to stay, but as a living world where storytelling and style intersect.

The new collection, complete with accessories, loungewear, and kids’ items, creates a harmonious balance between refined comfort and sophisticated design. From sweatshirts in signature The Ritz-Carlton light blue adorned with the iconic lion embroidery, to long pajama sets crafted from airy cotton, each piece reflects playful details and thoughtful craftsmanship throughout.

At The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo, select items are available for purchase at the 45th-floor lobby.

March in Japan means one thing: sakura season. And while the petals take their time to bloom, we are ready to serve up the season in full at @fstokyo.
 
Start with Sakura Afternoon Tea, where Executive Pastry Chef Patrick Thibaud proves that high tea is a delicious art form—think petal-shaped biscuits dipped cherry blossom-infused white chocolate ganache and perfectly rolled cakes with sakura chantilly cream, best enjoyed in our Champagne Lounge for peak springtime elegance.
 
For those who prefer their sakura to-go, the Sakura Mille-Feuille makes for an exquisite springtime gift (or a well-earned treat to enjoy under the petals). As evening falls, sip on Sakura Tokyo, a cocktail of sakura-infused liqueur and Japanese craft gin, designed for those who like their blossoms with a bit more bite.
 
For a seasonal refresh, the Spa’s Sakura Detox Treatment (March 1–April 14) is here to reset, rejuvenate, and wrap you in cherry-blossom serenity.
 
Book your sakura-colored itinerary now from our link in bio. March in Japan is one to remember.

Cozy Winter Getaway at The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo

As the crisp winter air fills the city, experience the warmth of the season with our limited-time Cozy Winter Getaway package.

Your stay includes daily breakfast at the bistronomy restaurant Towers or in the Club Lounge, a JPY 10,000 hotel credit to enjoy at the spa or dining venues, and an original tumbler to take home as a keepsake of your stay. Unwind in the Heat Experience area, featuring a pool, sauna, and hot bath.

For those staying on the Club Level, enjoy an even more personalized experience with five daily food presentations and the attentive service of a dedicated concierge in the Club Lounge.

Cherish a luxurious winter escape with someone special, and create warm memories in a serene haven above the city.

At The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo, we are committed to offering a sustainable stay aligned with the ideals of the SDGs.

Our bath amenities feature environmentally conscious refillable bottles, filled with “Philosykos” by the French fragrance maison Diptyque.
This exquisite scent blends the fresh green of fig leaves, the milky sweetness of the fruit, and the warmth of white wood, spreading gently throughout the space.

Wrap yourself in this soothing fragrance with the bath gel, and as you layer on the lotion, the scent deepens—enveloping you in a veil of moisture and calm as your stay begins.

Héritage by Kei Kobayashi is a fine dining restaurant supervised by Chef Kei Kobayashi,
who has earned three Michelin stars for six consecutive years in the French edition of the Michelin Guide.

Under the direction of Chef Teruki Murashima, the restaurant presents Gastronomie Cuisine Française—
a refined expression of seasonal aromas and flavors, crafted from carefully selected ingredients sourced from across Japan.

Each dish reflects the essence of its ingredients and the changing beauty of the four seasons.
Experience a new world of gastronomy where Chef Kobayashi’s philosophy and Japanese aesthetics harmoniously intertwine.

July 25 is Kakigori Day in Japan—
a day to celebrate summer with a touch of indulgence.??

Inspired by a playful wordplay on “7 (na) – 2 (tsu) – 5 (go) – ori,” this special day is the perfect occasion to savour a new seasonal creation at Star Hill, our Chinese restaurant: Persimmon Kakigori.

This elegant shaved ice dessert features a rich syrup made from fully ripened persimmons, offering a mellow yet deeply flavourful taste. Treat yourself to a moment of cool luxury on a hot summer day.

To enrich family stays, The Ritz-Carlton offers the immersive Ritz Kids program, designed to spark curiosity and creativity in young guests.
As part of this initiative, we have introduced “Kids Blocks”, crafted by upcycling used bamboo chopsticks.

Chopsticks that once served in our restaurants are reborn as building blocks, inspiring children’s creativity while conveying the importance of sustainability and care for nature. Each block represents a promise toward a more sustainable future, blending play with learning in a way that is unique to The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo.

The Kids Blocks are included as part of the Ritz Kids Night Safari experience, and can also be taken home as a memorable keepsake from their stay.

In the newly announced MICHELIN Guide 2026 Tokyo,
 Héritage by Kei Kobayashi has been awarded one star for the second consecutive year.
We would like to extend our gratitude and sincerest Thank You to our guests for their continuous support.

The philosophy of supervising chef Kei Kobayashi is rooted in three pillars: mastery, challenge, and innovation.
Guided by this belief, his creations blend the French cuisine with Japanese sensibilities, elevating gastronomy into a form of art.

Placing each guest as the protagonist upon the stage of the restaurant, Héritage continues to share with the world a new vision of Gastronomie Cuisine Française—crafted through refined techniques, exceptional ingredients, and a spirit of innovation.

Inspired by the timeless charm of ekiben, station bento boxes once carried by train-bound travelers, this campaign transforms a national tradition into a refined, modern dining experience.
"Flavors in Transit” invites guests to embark on a journey through time, tradition, and taste where every dish tells the story of a region, a ritual, and a rediscovered delight.

At The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo, the “Memories from My Childhood Teppanyaki Afternoon Tea” will be available on the following dates:
September 21, 28, and every Saturday and Sunday from October 4 to November 16.

May your very first nail experience become a cherished memory.

At The Ritz-Carlton Spa, Tokyo, we offer the Kids Adventure Manicure/Pedicure—a gentle treatment designed especially for our youngest guests.

In this 30-minute session, children enjoy nail care, a relaxing massage, fun color selection, and a careful coating of polish. After the treatment, each guest receives a bottle of Petit Manucurist nail polish to take home as a keepsake.

Formulated to wash off easily with soap and warm water, it allows the joy of the nail experience to continue at home.
Let your child enjoy a moment of gentle, high-quality self-care—the perfect first step into the world of wellness.

Each dish sparkles like a jewel, offering a truly exquisite course meal.

Reservations are accepted up to one week before your preferred date.

Teppanyaki Afternoon Tea – A Luxurious Summer Experience for the Senses
At Hinokizaka’s Teppanyaki, enjoy vibrant seasonal treasures presented in refreshing tableware.
One highlight is the day’s fresh fish, delivered directly from the source, paired with fresh sea urchin and zunda miso—capturing the depth of flavor and the essence of the season.
For dessert, the “Grapes, Organic Herb Sherbet” offers a cool, lingering finish, as if sealing in the summer sunlight with every bite.

This is a new-style afternoon tea where teppanyaki techniques meet the delicate pairing of fine teas.
Savor the meticulously crafted and elegant summer flavors, reminiscent of a tea kaiseki, alongside the masterful skills displayed right before your eyes.

A Refined Summer Delight at Hinokizaka
?
Step into the elegance of Hinokizaka, nestled within The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo, where tradition meets luxury.
?
This summer’s exclusive kaiseki highlights the rare Amakusa Blue Eel, prized for its pure flavor, tender texture, and delicate richness—carefully selected by Chef de Cuisine, Hinokizaka, Hisao Ishida.
?
The experience honors "Doyo no Ushi no Hi"—a centuries-old Japanese custom of enjoying eel to restore energy and vitality during the hottest days of summer.
?
Available: Tuesday, July 1 – Sunday, August 31, 2025

On May 28, 2025, we hosted a one-night-only special event, The Ritz-Carlton Night, at The Lobby Lounge & Bar.?Held as part of the Flamenco Jazz Festival Japan, the evening featured Chef Israel Ramos of Mantúa, a Michelin one-star restaurant in Spain, who treated guests to an extraordinary dining experience created by blending his culinary artistry with subtle Japanese influences. A powerful live flamenco performance from world-renowned dancer Nino de los Reyes and top-tier artists further elevated the evening.?Set against the glittering Tokyo skyline 200 meters above the city, it was a night of stirring flavors and unforgettable sounds. Thank you to everyone who joined us for this memorable occasion.

Taste the first whispers of summer at The Lobby Lounge! 

Our new seasonal menu spotlights the unique flavor of Okinawan Peach Pineapple.

First up is the Pineapple Exotique Saint-Honoré a vibrant dessert layered with pineapple, mango, and passion fruit topped with cream delicately scented with banana and accented by frozen pineapple hidden within. Each bite captures the bright essence of the season.

For a savory delight, the Okinawan Peach Pineapple and Braised Pork Belly features melt-in-your-mouth pork simmered with the sweet and tangy notes of peach pineapple. Finished with house-made yuzu pepper, this refined dish pairs beautifully with sake and other Japanese spirits.

Celebrate the arrival of summer with these two seasonal creations—an early tropical escape right in the heart of Tokyo.

The Saint-Honoré will be available starting May 9, and the Okinawan Peach Pine and Braised Pork Belly (Kakuni)  from May 12.

Available from June 1 to July 27, the seven-course journey begins with delicate appetizers and continues to the signature wagyu tsukune-style burger, finishing with a dessert of the season’s freshest fruits.

Delight in the harmony of expert craftsmanship in eight exquisite dishes showcasing seasonal flavors from around Japan.

A Culinary Art Passed Down Through The Ages

Inspired by the legendary Chef Auguste Escoffier, who laid the foundation of French gastronomy, The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo, presents: “Grand Classic Afternoon Tea – Inspired by Chef Escoffier” - available from Tuesday, August 5.

Delight in a timeless afternoon tea featuring a selection of classic savory items reimagined by The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo. Elegant and delicate sweets, freshly baked scones, and a vibrant dessert trolley — each detail crafted with poetic refinement.

As a unique takeaway, guests will also receive an exclusive blend of green tea, available only at The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo, where you can continue the elegant experience in the comfort of your home.

Newly introduced this month, the “Synactif Purifying Body & Facial” is a luxurious 90-minute treatment that offers both body and facial care in one seamless experience. Exclusive to The Ritz-Carlton Spa, Tokyo, this course features Synactif, the most prestigious skincare line by Shiseido.

Wrapped in the delicate scent of Synactif Rose, this all-hand treatment gently works on the legs, back, and décolleté to enhance circulation and bring a sense of lightness to the body. Complementing this is a facial using advanced skincare by Clé de Peau Beauté, revealing a radiant, crystal-clear complexion.

Created in response to guest requests, this 90-minute ritual offers a deeply purifying and revitalizing journey for both body and mind.

Launching on May 1, “WELLNESS RITUALS” is a two-night stay package designed to awaken your natural beauty and vitality through three pillars: Mind, Body, and Skin.

Step away from the city’s hustle and into a gentle morning filled with intention — beginning with a nourishing breakfast at Bistronomy Towers, followed by tailored, restorative wellness treatments and mindful breathing exercises with a take-home set of self-care wisdom cards to integrate sustainable wellness every day.

Let this transformative experience guide you toward a brighter, more radiant version of yourself — one that shines from within.

One taste, a lingering memory created.

At Héritage by Kei Kobayashi—the restaurant shaped by the refined sensibilities of Chef Kei Kobayashi, the first Japanese chef to earn three Michelin stars in Paris—each amuse-bouche tells a quiet, elegant story.

One such creation is the “Tuna Tartare and Caviar Monaka.” Nestled inside a crisp Japanese monaka shell is a delicate tuna tartare paired with the subtle bitterness of nanohana (rapeseed blossoms). Adding to the richness is the “Crystal Caviar” from Kaviari, carefully selected by Chef Kobayashi.

A lasting impression, an unforgettable start to the course, and a celebration of spring’s awakening - all through fine gastronomy.

Around Tokyo / ??????? 

Just over 30 minutes by train from The Capitol Hotel Tokyu,  is one of Japan’s most iconic and oldest Buddhist temples, dating back to the 7th century. Dedicated to Kannon, the goddess of mercy, it attracts millions of visitors annually. Rich in history and spiritual significance, the temple offers a glimpse into Japan’s cultural heritage, making it a must-visit destination for tourists and locals alike.

Kochi Sushi Dinner - embark on an unforgettable culinary voyage to Kochi at Hinokizaka.

From the pristine waters of Sukumo Bay (home to over 70% of Japan's fish species) to its lush mountains, our exquisite menu showcases Kochi's unparalleled seafood, vibrant produce, and renowned sake. 

Indulge in a rare delicacy: Steamed Moray Eel with Yuba (tofu skin), a true Kanto rarity. Complete your experience with Kuri Shochu on the rocks, crafted from Kochi's prized chestnuts. The subtle sweetness perfectly complements the moray eel's rich umami.

Please note that the menu may be subject to change depending on availability.

This spring, discover a magnificent Kamon art installation at The Lobby celebrating Japanese tradition and the singular beauty of the cherry-blossom season. 

Crafted in collaboration with father-and-son artist duo Shoryu and Yoho Hatoba, the piece is a striking Kamon artwork incorporating the hotel's original emblem, with sakura motifs on Japanese washi paper. The artwork will be on display from March 1 until May 9, 2025.

In celebration of Japan's rich artistic heritage, The Peninsula Tokyo proudly presents an extraordinary blend of tradition and modernity: The Peninsula Tokyo Ukiyo-e.

Ukiyo-e, originating in the 17th century, captured contemporary life, Kabuki actors, and iconic landmarks. These vibrant prints, which influenced Western artists like Van Gogh, became timeless symbols of Japanese culture.

Crafted over nine months, renowned painter Mr. OZ, together with master woodcarvers, printers and publisher, has brought to life three original Ukiyo-e prints that blend the elegance of the Edo period with the modern-day charm of The Peninsula Tokyo.

Discover the artistry of beautifully intertwined past and present.

Héritage by Kei Kobayashi, awarded one Michelin star in the MICHELIN Guide Tokyo for two consecutive years, invites you to enjoy a gastronomic experience created exclusively for the winter season.

As the year draws to a close and a new one begins, savor moments that linger quietly in the heart. Each dish, crafted with seasonal ingredients such as Hokkaido Ezo venison and Nanatani duck from Kyoto, elevates French culinary techniques through refined Japanese sensibility, weaving a memorable winter tale on every plate.

Whether shared with someone special or enjoyed as a personal indulgence, we invite you to experience this season’s exclusive festive menus and create lasting memories.

Holiday Lunch | December 31, January 1 – 4
New Year’s Eve Dinner | December 31
New Year’s Dinner | January 1
Holiday Dinner | January 2 – 4

Happy New Year from all of us at The Peninsula Tokyo! 

As we step into 2025, we wish you a year filled with health, happiness, and unforgettable moments. Our team is excited to continue creating special experiences for every guest who walks through our doors.

Thank you for your support—we can’t wait to welcome you back and make your time with us truly memorable.

This holiday season, experience the festive charm of Tokyo with exclusive accommodation packages at The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo. 
The ”Celebrate in Style” package includes hotel credits and spa benefits, perfect for an indulgent getaway. For those seeking tranquility, the "Winter Escape" package features ESPA aroma candles to elevate your stay. Meanwhile, the "Santa Suite" offers a suite stay complete with a Christmas cake and the joy of decorating your own in-room Christmas tree. 
Each package includes breakfast and tickets to the "KOSÉ MIDTOWN ICE RINK" at Tokyo Midtown Grass Square, starting November 22, allowing you to enjoy a quintessential winter experience. Surround yourself with the magic of "MIDTOWN CHRISTMAS 2024", where the iconic Promenade of Lights and enchanting floating bubbles performances create an unforgettable holiday atmosphere. Celebrate the season with elegance, warmth, and unforgettable memories.

Shichi-Go-San Celebrations
Shichi-Go-San is a cherished Japanese tradition celebrating children at the ages of three, five and seven. After a blessing at neighbouring Hie Shrine, continue the celebration with a refined family gathering at The Capitol Hotel Tokyu, where our restaurants offer a warm and memorable setting for this special day.

Known for her detailed, captivating creations, she has shared her work worldwide. The performance will be from 5:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. on December 5 and 3:30 p.m. to 8 p.m. on December 6 to 9, 2024.

Once a costume maker, now the quiet wizard of thread and needle at @fstokyo. 

Since the hotel's opening 23 years ago, our resident seamstress, Hasegawa-san, has embroidered initials with mastery, breathed new life into well-loved apparel, and have outfitted teddy bears in stunning, upcycled kimono for our guests to take home. 

If these halls had a seam, she would be the one holding it all together.

This festive season, The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo presents a selection of Christmas cakes, each with its own unique charm. 

"Jasmine Grapefruit Raspberry Cake" – A refreshing symphony of luxurious lychee cream and delicate jasmine mousse. 
"Chocolate Citrus Chestnut Cake" – Limited edition, featuring moist chestnut cake nestled inside a chocolate house. 
"Almond Caramelia Calamansi Cake" – A delightful blend of smooth caramel mousse and zesty calamansi cream. 
"Strawberry Shortcake" – A beloved classic, alcohol-free and perfect for all ages. 

Celebrate the holidays with the cake that brings joy to your season. Which one will you choose?

A restorative moment to welcome the beginning of a new year.

Immerse yourself in “Blissful Stones” at The Ritz-Carlton Spa, Tokyo: a 90-minute treatment where the gentle heat of warm stones meets the skilled touch of our therapists.

Placed along the back and chakra points, the stones release deep, soothing warmth that eases tension and melts away fatigue from within.
In a cocoon of quiet stillness, the mind and body begin to realign, inviting a sense of renewal from the inside out.

Listen to your inner calm, and gift yourself a moment of care and serenity.

Indulge in the Flavors of Autumn at The Lobby Lounge

Savor the essence of the season with our elegant dessert selection.
Delight in the Caramel Apple Chiboust Tart, a harmonious creation featuring the rich aroma of caramelized apples paired with a light buckwheat tart and smooth chiboust cream.

Also on offer is the Fig Shortcake Verrine, where Japanese figs take center stage alongside layers of mascarpone mousse, rice flour sponge, and refreshing sorbet — a perfect balance of texture and flavor.

Each creation is crafted with care, offering gluten-free and vegetarian-friendly options for a gentle yet refined taste experience.
Available for a limited time until mid-November.
Enjoy these exquisite sweets that capture the beauty of the season.

Bastien Gonzalez, the world-renowned pioneer in foot care who has captivated many celebrities, will be visiting The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo.

Known as the founder of Pedi:Mani:Cure Studio by Bastien Gonzalez, his treatments embody a revolutionary approach that fuses medical expertise with beauty. His delicate and innovative care has earned worldwide acclaim.

In Japan, this exclusive program is available only at The Ritz-Carlton Spa, Tokyo. For two special days, Mr. Gonzalez himself will personally provide treatments, allowing you a rare opportunity to experience the true essence of world-class foot care.

Dates & Times
 •  September 30, 2025 (Tue): 3:00 p.m. / 4:30 p.m. / 6:00 p.m.
 •  October 1, 2025 (Wed): 2:00 p.m.

Details
 •  Each session: 60 minutes
 •  Fee: ¥65,000 (inclusive of tax, service charge, and gift box)

Contact the Spa Reception for reservations.
Tel: 03-6434-8813
Email: rc.tyorz.spa.department@ritzcarlton.com

Honoring the spirit that has shaped us since our debut, this renewal brings a fresh, contemporary perspective while preserving the quiet elegance that defines us. Our doors are now open and we look forward to welcoming you home very soon.

Main Entrance? An Entrance that Reflects Japanese Hospitality?

Inspired by the Japanese spirit of hospitality and designed, our entrance reflects the traditional custom of sweeping the garden and sprinkling water to welcome guests.
Designed by Kengo Kuma, one of Japan’s leading architects and the mind behind the main stadium of the Tokyo 2020 Olympics, the feel of a traditional garden is beautifully expressed through the rippling surface of the water feature.

Hakusan Shrine – where a hidden hydrangea sanctuary awaits.

Step into a sea of hydrangeas blooming quietly in the heart of Tokyo.
With around 3,000 hydrangea bushes surrounding the shrine and park, this local gem is the perfect blend of tradition and natural beauty.
The contrast between vivid blue blossoms and red torii gates creates a truly photogenic scene.

Awarded one Michelin star in the Michelin Guide Tokyo 2025, Héritage by Kei Kobayashi is a culinary stage where the traditions of French cuisine are reimagined with innovation under the supervision of Kei Kobayashi, the first Japanese chef to earn three Michelin stars in Paris.

Consider each course a whispered promise, uniquely crafted for this day, an intimate dialogue between our kitchen and your table.

One such example was our "Pan-Seared Sea Bream with Seasonal Vegetables and Fresh Seaweed Sauce." Perfectly crisped sea bream scales meet fresh, vibrant vegetables and a deeply flavorful seaweed sauce. A dish that lingers in the memory, a harmony of technique and beauty.

Come and experience the singular story that unfolds at Héritage by Kei Kobayashi.

Indulge in a seasonal menu highlighting the finest ingredients paired with panoramic views of Tokyo at Bistronomy Towers.

Through July, a standout starter is the creamy potato soup, delicately topped with snow crab and a rich crab foam that captures the essence of the sea.

As a main course available through September, we recommend the grilled Aichi duck—a prized ingredient hand-selected by Chef Takuji Nakano. The duck is expertly prepared to a rosy, fragrant finish and served with a house-made sauce using spices and duck liver.

From mid-May through June, don’t miss the white asparagus from France, elegantly paired with fragrant truffle vinaigrette and Osaka Wagyu bresaola, combined with a soft-boiled egg.

At the front entrance of the hotel, the enormous, handcrafted mask “Gutsy”, welcomes guests with a mischievous grin. ?
?
In the same way that masks that are said to “bring happiness” are often displayed at the entrances of hotels throughout Europe, “Gutsy” is also decorated with our intent to welcome all guests of Park Hyatt Tokyo with warm hospitality and a friendly smile. ?
?
During the holiday season, he even joins in the festivities sometimes by dressing up in a bow tie. ?
?
We look forward to welcoming you when we reopen in October 2025.?

Imagine strolling along a path lined with blossoming cherry trees in warm spring sunshine. This is the inspiration behind our special "Sakura Scented Brûlée Cheesecake." This smooth, moist cake is rich in cream cheese and caramelized with French cane sugar – its crunchy texture softened by fresh raspberries and a crumbly sable base. The cake is one of an array of springtime drinks, dishes and sweets curated by The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo at BLOSSOM CAFÉ in Midtown Garden, just next to the hotel.  Come and enjoy a taste of spring. Open until April 14.

Park Hyatt Tokyo is proud to be a hub for art and culture, and over the past 30 years, we've had the opportunity to collaborate with many esteemed artists to produce one of a kind, exclusive experiences.?
?
Here are a few of our favorite collaborations - which one is yours? #PHT30thAnniversary?
?
[1] Japanese restaurant Kozue creates a special menu to be served on custom made karatsu-yaki pottery decorated by renowned calligrapher Suito Nakatsuka (@suitou), and hand-crafted by Japanese potter Sakurei Okamoto.?
?
[2] One of the UK's most respected fashion designers and Park Hyatt Tokyo friend, Sir Paul Smith (@paulsmith), designs limited-edition plates for the New York Grill in celebration of our 20th anniversary.?
?
[3,4] New York artist Aerosyn-Lex Mestrovic (@aerosynlex) collaborates with the us on a luxury chocolate bar set, featuring his work prominently printed on the packaging, to coincide with a live painting performance.?

As you exit the elevator on the 41st floor, a lush bamboo forest high above the Tokyo skyline awaits - welcome to The Peak Lounge.?
?
Complemented by a glass atrium, this bright, airy hall full of greenery is one of our hotel's most recognizable spaces, and embodies Park Hyatt Tokyo's intention to serve as an "urban oasis" in one of the busiest cities in the world.?
?
At The Peak Lounge, you are sheltered from the hustle and bustle of the city below and offered a sanctuary of calm to which you can retreat after a long day.?

We spent July revisiting many of the hotel’s most iconic spots and reliving some of your favorite memories shared at our anniversary hashtag #PHT30thAnniversary.?
?
As we fondly look back, we are also excited to welcome you back in October 2025, after restoring the public and event areas, restaurants and bars, while evolving the hotel’s technical infrastructure, and enhancing guest room comfort, convenience, and technology. Please be assured that as we start this exciting new chapter, our unique personality, style and spirit will remain unchanged and timeless.?
?
In the words of our dear friends Sofia Coppola, Ryuichi Sakamoto, and Shuichi Yoshida - artists we were honored to celebrate our 25th anniversary with - we endeavor to continue being as unique, symbolic, and finely curated as you have allowed us to be for the last 30 years.?
?
Please follow us to stay updated on the progress of our restoration program and we look forward to making numerous new memories together!?
?

Discover Kobe with our culinary team on the Chef's Blog!?
?
Did you know that only approximately 3,000 cattle are Kobe certified each year? Accounting for only 0.06% of total Japanese beef consumption, all Kobe certified cattle are assigned a 10-digit ID number, in order to prove their authenticity and allow it to be traced back to a specific cow.?
?
Writing about the culinary team's recent visit to Kobe in Hy?go prefecture, Chef Ben Wheeler (@chefbenwheeler), Chef de Cuisine of New York Grill & Bar, guides us through their visit to a beef ranch, auction, and tasting session with our beef supplier, alongside Executive Chef Thibault Chiumenti (@chef_thibault_chiumenti), Food & Beverage Manager Yasukazu Yokota, and Materials Manager Ryo Nagata.?
?
Check out the full article via the link in our bio, or at https://restaurants.tokyo.park.hyatt.co.jp/en/blog/4027.html!?

Héritage = Legacy, Inheritance.
As contributors to passing on the culture of French cuisine to the next generation, we go beyond transmitting recipes and techniques. Alongside our skilled chef and pastry chef team, we embark on a new culinary journey at 'Héritage by Kei Kobayashi,' paying homage to French cuisine. We invite you to savor the distinctive delicacies exclusive to our restaurant, crafted through unique collaborations in this space.

Park Hyatt Tokyo would like to take this opportunity to thank you for all your amazing support over the past 30 years. 

Beginning today, we are pausing our operations to begin a 17-month comprehensive restoration program in celebration of our 30th anniversary this year. 

During this time, all hotel facilities and services will be closed while we refresh and restore the public and event areas, restaurants, and bars, while also enhancing guestroom comfort, convenience, and technology. We can assure you that our unique personality, style, and spirit will remain unchanged and timeless. 

Please continue to follow us for the latest restoration updates, and we look forward to welcoming you home in Autumn 2025!

Step into @ArvabyAman and be greeted by a beautiful folding screen, known as the ‘Nymph’s View’. It depicts the perspective of a forest spirit, hiding among the branches and leaves and gazing down from the treetops. This resonates profoundly at Aman Tokyo, likened to a large tree towering above Otemachi forest, with inspiring views across the city. It’s moments like this which echo with the Aman philosophy of ‘coexistence with nature.’

Azure 45 will operate with a new menu and under the culinary supervision of Chef Kei Kobayashi, owner and chef of Restaurant KEI, the first Asian chef to win three Michelin stars in France, from August 6, 2023. 
 
Under the guidance of Chef Kei Kobayashi, who creates an artistic world view, we have taken inspiration from his passion for art, fashion, travel, and nature, and arranged traditional and orthodox French cuisine in a modern way. We will sincerely express our new culinary worldview to pass it on to the next generation. 
 
Message from Chef Kei Kobayashi - 
“Inspired by the great masters of the culinary world and the history of French cuisine, I will continue to pursue the balance between tradition and modernity, texture and flavor that I aim for. I am delighted to be able to share with you my contemporary interpretation of traditional French cuisine and its worldview.” 
 
We look forward to welcoming you at Azure 45.
 
Azure 45 (45th floor) 
Lunch : 12:00-16:00 (last entry at 13:30) 
Dinner : 18:00-22:30 (last entry at 20:00) 
Closed : every Monday and Tuesday

Reward yourself with a luxurious reset of your mind and body and welcome good fortune for 2025.

From January 25th to February 8th, rejuvenate with our "New Year Celebration Treatment" (¥68,800, 105 minutes total), a full-body treatment and facial care experience enhanced by the comforting warmth of hot stone melters.

After the treatment, reflect on your New Year's resolutions with a raspberry yokan featuring the Year of the Snake motif and an aromatic herbal tea blend.

Choose from two luxurious oils for your treatment:

- Connection Bath & Body Oil: Infused with ylang-ylang and jasmine, this oil fosters a deep connection between mind and body, promoting better communication.
- Positivity Bath & Body Oil: A blend of jasmine, gardenia, and citrus notes enhances happiness and encourages positivity.

Six Ritz-Carlton hotels across Japan invite you to embark on a gastronomic journey titled “FLAVORS IN TRANSIT.” Inspired by Japan’s unique ekiben culture, indulge in an exploration of flavors and sensibilities that are distinctly Japanese.

From The Ritz-Carlton, Tokyo:
Executive Teppanyaki Chef Yuki Oe introduces “Memories from My Childhood: Teppanyaki Afternoon Tea.”

Inspired by journeys with his mother, carrying his grandmother’s homemade bento, Chef Oe reimagines those cherished memories into a refined “bento” that serves as the prologue to the course.

This unique experience intertwines ingredients discovered along the way with the warmth of family memories. Each dish, paired with delicate premium teas, is presented with the artistry of teppanyaki, creating an elegant dining journey reminiscent of a Japanese cha-kaiseki. From savory bites to sweets, indulge in each course as masterful techniques unfold before your eyes.

Availability: September 21 & 28, 2025, and every Saturday & Sunday from October 4 to November 16

Did you know? Tucked away on Level 7 and just above the bustling Naka Dori Avenue, you’ll spot a winged white gargoyle perched among the leafy greenery. Crafted by artist Yoshiharu Kuroda and installed in 1952 as part of the original building on this site, the sculpture was meant to ward off evil. The figure has become a symbol of good luck, and when The Peninsula Tokyo was built, the gargoyle was carefully reinstalled in its new perch. 

It’s a little secret that adds a touch of charm to your stay—something you can only truly appreciate when you take the time to look up.

This relief artwork features selected kana characters from the calligraphy of Hon'ami K?etsu, held in the Goto Museum collection.

Where every journey begins - with timeless grace.

Tokyo Station, designed by Kingo Tatsuno and completed in 1914, stands as a cherished icon of Japan’s modern architectural heritage. Just steps away, KITTE Marunouchi breathes new life into the former Tokyo Central Post Office, featuring a design by Kengo Kuma, the architect behind our hotel.

At KITTE Marunouchi, you can enjoy shopping for unique Japanese products, dining, and events in a vibrant setting. Discover the spirit of tradition and innovation woven into the very heart of Tokyo.

?? From our hotel, it’s approximately a 15-minute taxi or train ride.

The view—especially at golden hour—is the perfect backdrop to a memorable meal.

Meet the Team – Tempura Chef Hiroshi Hasegawa?

Having dedicated his career to tempura since his early twenties, Chef Hasegawa has trained under a wide range of mentors - each with unique philosophies and techniques. Today, he brings his own refined style to Japanese Restaurant Suiren.
“Tempura brings out the essence of each ingredient. Every day is a once-in-a-lifetime encounter - the state of the ingredients changes daily. I adjust the batter, the temperature, and the texture for each item, keeping it simple but deeply expressive. Tempura is endlessly captivating.”

Janu Tokyo is enriched with dynamic works of art designed to inspire and energise. This striking piece, created by Japanese artist Sakuho Ito, draws on the rich traditions of Japanese Iwakura culture and the craftsmanship of washi mask-making used in Kagura dances. By replicating the form of a natural stone using delicate washi paper, the work captures a sense of mystique and transformation. Connecting with art here becomes a source of renewal, energising you for what lies ahead.

Relax in the vibrant atmosphere of Janu Lounge, where impeccable flavours, lively conversation, and stunning views come together effortlessly.

Earth Day??Luxury Meets Responsibility

We are deeply committed to promoting a sustainable future at The Capitol Hotel Tokyu, a luxury five-star property. In our guest rooms, we have introduced label-free aluminium bottled water and dispenser-style bath amenities, significantly reducing single-use plastics.
As a hotel that values both comfort and our impact on the environment, we will continue to take thoughtful steps towards a more sustainable tomorrow.

Nezu Museum: A tranquil cultural gem in the heart of Tokyo

Located in the stylish Aoyama district, the Nezu Museum is home to a remarkable collection of traditional Japanese and East Asian art. With its rich collection of East Asian art and beautifully landscaped Japanese gardens, the Nezu Museum offers a peaceful escape from the city. Just a 10-minute taxi ride from The Capitol Hotel Tokyu

On the table: a slice of premium wagyu from the renowned Ozaki farm located in Miyazaki prefecture. Cut exclusively for @maisonmarunouchi’s Festive Dinner, this beautifully marbled meat is aged for 90 days to give it an extra depth of umami and seared on a charcoal grill to finish. A standout main dish and the night’s showstopper, the Ozaki rib steak boasts a deeply flavourful taste without a trace of heaviness. 
 
Presented with a plate of artfully latticed pomme pont neuf (Parisien fried potatoes), featuring thinly sliced potatoes that have been baked and pressed into crispy wedges. Other highlights include Poached Foie Gras Terrine and Scallop Tortellini with Oscetra Caviar.

?? The Capitol Hotel Tokyu awarded “Responsible Hospitality VERIFIED™” Certification

The Capitol Hotel Tokyu has obtained certification from Responsible Hospitality VERIFIED™, an industry-leading sustainability standard.
Having achieved five consecutive Forbes Travel Guide five-star ratings, our hotel is now the first in Tokyo to receive their Responsible Hospitality VERIFIED™ sustainability certification. This distinction is granted to luxury hotels across more than 80 countries that meet exceptionally high sustainability standards. Evaluations are based on over 100 rigorous criteria, including environmental conservation, waste reduction, the use of sustainable amenities, health and safety measures, and community engagement.

Our ongoing efforts to reduce the environmental impact and promote sustainable hotel operations have been acknowledged with this certification. We remain committed to fostering responsible hospitality, ensuring that our initiatives continue to support both society and the environment.

We are delighted to present three original Ukiyo-e designs that celebrate local culture and support the artisans preserving the beautiful Ukiyo-e tradition. Created over nine months by artist Mr. OZ in collaboration with carvers Ms. Nagai and Ms. Abe, and master printer Mr. Ogawa, these pieces blend contemporary and Edo-period themes, all set against the backdrop of The Peninsula Tokyo.

Explore our special exhibition on level B1 of the hotel, featuring the original prints on traditional Japanese paper alongside matching vibrant canvas paintings. Discover original sketches and the actual woodblocks used in the printing process. Don't miss this captivating fusion of past and present!

Rainbow Bridge: A Modern Icon of Tokyo

Spanning Tokyo Bay, the Rainbow Bridge connects the city centre with Odaiba, a vibrant entertainment district on a man-made island. More than just a transport link, it offers stunning views—especially at night when illuminated in rainbow colours. Ride the Yurikamome Line, an automated guideway transit system with a front-row view of the futuristic cityscape, or walk across for panoramic skyline views. 

It is approximately 20 to 30 minutes by car from the hotel.

The Capitol’s Special “Hinamatsuri” Cake ??
Inspired by the traditional hishimochi (diamond-shaped rice cake traditionally displayed during Hinamatsuri or Girls’ Day), this limited-edition cake features layers of fluffy matcha sponge, fresh strawberries, and whipped cream. Topped with charming decorations of the Emperor and Empress dolls and delicately designed flower petals, each cake is a unique celebration of Hinamatsuri.

You might think that it’s Cherry Blossom that signals the start of spring but the plum, which typically flower in February and March, are amongst the first blossoms of the year. 
Koishikawa Korakuen, a short distance from our hotel, is one of the best places to enjoy this wonderful sight. Like many Japanese gardens, Koishikawa Korakuen reproduces landscapes in miniature, using ponds, stones, trees and man-made hills to replicate both Japanese and Chinese scenery.

Meiji Jingu: A Timeless Tokyo Escape 

Located between the famous Omotesando street with its luxury shops, Harajuku, nexus of Tokyo youth culture, and Yoyogi park, beloved haven for Tokyoites needing a bit of fresh air, Meiji Jingu is a deserved stalwart for domestic and international visitors. Art at The Capitol: 'Fuji' by Misao Yokoyama ?
A masterpiece by Misao Yokoyama, one of the most influential Nihonga artists of the Showa era, 'Fuji' captivates with its bold lines and dynamic energy. 
Originally displayed in the former hotel’s Misao Lounge, this striking work now welcomes guests on the first floor.
The Capitol proudly showcases a collection of exquisite artworks inherited from its predecessor. As you explore the hotel, we invite you to take a moment to appreciate these timeless pieces.

Setsubun - Welcome To Spring ??

The special ‘Fukumame’ features caramelized hazelnuts coated in blonde chocolate all served in a custom masu box with a delightful chocolate mask. Available from January 15.

Welcoming a New Season: Setsubun Festival at Hie Shrine

Adjacent to our hotel, the historic Hie Shrine hosts its annual Setsubun Festival, a traditional Japanese ceremony that purifies misfortune and invites happiness to mark the arrival of a new season.

The ritual of bean-throwing (mamemaki) is a sacred act to cleanse negative energy and usher in good fortune. Every year, this vibrant celebration draws many visitors, creating a lively and joyous atmosphere.

New Year ‘Shishimai’ Lion Dance

Shishimai is a festive dance performed in lion costumes at celebrations and festivals during the New Year. The word "shishimai" is made up of the words "shishi" which means "lion" and "mai" which means "dance". The performing lion “bites” children to ward off bad luck, improve schoolwork and bring good health.

Here’s what’s new at #FSTokyo this October:
 
On October 10, @sezannetokyo presents a one-night-only dinner celebrating the 10th Anniversary of the Krug x Single Ingredient Program. Enjoy a pairing menu inspired by edible flowers, crafted by Krug Ambassade Executive Chef Daniel Calvert. The restaurant will also welcome Olivier Collin from Champagne’s single estate winery, Ulysse Collin, on October 22 for an evening of sparkling splendor. Join us for a special pairing dinner featuring vintage Ulysse Collin champagne. 
 
At @maisonmarunouchi , celebrate Halloween with the whimsical Halloween Afternoon Tea, as iconic characters like Count Dracula and Jack-o’-Lantern make a festive appearance. Raise a toast to the spooky season the Bar’s  white chocolate-webbed Halloween cocktail made specially for the occasion.
 
The Spa offers an autumn treatment featuring osmanthus, a perfect way to stay warm and relaxed as the season cools.
 
Discover more about our offerings at four seasons.com/tokyo.

Exclusive Goshuincho Notebook

Since 1963, our hotel has shared a rich history with Hie Shrine, nestled within the sacred Sanno Forest. Revered as a guardian deity of the Imperial Palace and recognised as one of Tokyo’s iconic locations of pawer, Hie Shrine has inspired this collaborative, hotel-original goshuincho (shrine stamp book).

??????????, ??????????: Master Sushi Chef Hiroyuki Musashi leads ?????????????? ???? ????????, an authentic Japanese ???????????? sushi omakase restaurant inside ???????? ??????????.

The complexity of techniques acquired over decades by a master sushi chef is immeasurable — requiring a keen sense of seasonality, minutiae fluctuations in temperature and sensibility to timing. Ingredients undergo extensive preparation before diners even reach the restaurant — skilled crafting of zuke (immersing in soy sauce), niru (simmering in a broth of soy, sake, mirin and sugar) and shime (curing with salt and vinegar) are what allow Musashi’s omakase to stand out from the rest through his unrelenting attention to texture, taste and detail.

Christmas Special Dinning Event?"Sanno no Mori Gourmet Club" 
The area of Sanno, where our hotel stands, was once home to the exclusive members-only restaurant "Hoshigaoka Saryo." Founded by the legendary gourmet Rosanjin Kitaoji, the Gourmet Club embraced a tradition of fine dining. 

Carrying forward this legacy, our Executive Chef, Toshinori Sogabe, presents an exquisite French dinner with a modern twist, centred around the theme of truffles.

Capitol Afternoon Tea and Stay available to book now

On Our Doorstep

Step outside our hotel and straight into some of the most fascinating and historically important sights and sounds of Tokyo. 

The iconic National Diet Building, where the Government sits, is moments away. Stretch your legs a little more and you’ll be in the tranquil peace of The Imperial Palace Gardens or the vibrant streets of Akasaka.

Matsutake Kaiseki at Suiren

Autumn has arrived at the Japanese Restaurant Suiren. Enjoy the distinct fragrant aroma of our Matsutake Kaiseki mushrooms and savour the deep umami of our delicious broth. Choose from dishes including Dobin Mushi, Tempura, Grilled Matsutake, and Matsutake Rice cooked in a traditional pot.

This Kaiseki experience embodies the essence of Japanese cuisine, crafted with meticulous care and artistry, presenting a feast that redefines the true spirit of washoku.

Available until Thursday, October 31st.

Shinshu Culinary Fair 

Immerse yourself in the flavours of Shinshu (Nagano), celebrated for its majestic mountains, rich soil, and diverse seasons. Enjoy drinks from the region, including Karuizawa beer and apple ciders made with local apples. 

The head chef Yamahashi, inspired by the bountiful and delicious ingredients of Shinshu, has crafted a menu that highlights their exquisite flavours and aromas. Experience the true taste of Shinshu like never before. Available at the Chinese Restaurant Star Hill until 30 Sept (Mon).

#LuxuryCapitolHotel #CapitolHotel #VisitJapan #LuxuryTokyo  #LuxuryJapan  #CapitolTokyuHotel #TokyoFoodie

?
Theatrical Tea Ceremony & Kaiseki Dining Experience

At Sokkon Cha & Kaiseki, the tea ceremony offers an immersive and innovative experience that is truly unforgettable. Lasting over two hours, guests will delve into the captivating ritual's culture, charm and hospitality, as well as a food and sake pairing.

The journey commences with a traditional omogashi sweet, followed by the tea ceremony conducted in a small wabi-sabi teahouse nestled in Sokkon's basement. Additionally, one of the courses features exquisitely prepared cocktails.
 
For more information please visit: 
https://www.sokkon.jp/english

Enjoy Shiko Munakata's masterpiece, ‘Ode to Willow Green Flower Red’ 

A legendary printmaker who made history with his unique 'ita-ga' woodblock prints - images born from the wood itself. 

This iconic piece was showcased at the 28th Venice Biennale in 1955, where it won the prestigious International Grand Prize for Prints. Experience the work up close at the Japanese Restaurant Suiren on the 3rd floor.

World Tourism Day 2024

This year, World Tourism Day focuses on the profound connection between tourism and peace.

Sustainable tourism can transform communities – creating jobs, fostering inclusion and strengthening local economies.

By valuing and preserving cultural and natural heritage, it can help reduce tensions and nurture peaceful coexistence. Tourism can also promote economic interdependence between neighbours, encouraging cooperation and peaceful development.

Tourism brings people together.

The Capitol Hotel Tokyu - Our Associates 
Main Kitchen Chef Yuji Asato 

“Our culinary offerings span Japanese, Western, and Chinese cuisine. We honour the hotel’s timeless concept, blending tradition with a modern, contemporary approach.“

Chef Yuji Asato joined the former Capitol Tokyu Hotel in 1986 and led the Keyaki Grill until its closure in 2006. Today, he directs banquets, culinary events, and oversees four restaurants, including the club lounge SaRyoh.

Designed by the great Kerry Hill, Aman Tokyo’s interior architecture is rooted in the spatial and material qualities of the traditional Japanese house, and the long hallway of the Garden Lounge on the 33rd floor is inspired by a veranda.

With its rock garden and green centrepiece, the Garden Lounge plays the role of a courtyard, where one can observe the changing seasons in an atmosphere of profound serenity.

Hei Fung Terrace's legendary Mini Egg Custard Mooncakes are back! ??

The Mid-Autumn Festival (celebrated on September 17th this year) is one of the most spectacular celebrations in the Chinese culture and mooncakes have long been a signature highlight and hallmark tradition of the festivities each year. Made with premium Hokkaido butter, salted duck egg yolk, and custard powder, our mooncakes are the perfect treat to share with friends, family, and loved ones. Make your reservation now via our official website.

‘A cup of shincha and a fresh hand towel arrives, and I exhale. Brewed from this year’s first harvest, the tea is bright yellow-green and smooth. Sen no Rikyu, famed tea master from the 16th century, used the term ‘ichigo ichie,’ on the incalculable worth of a moment-in-time. To understand that this one moment, one meeting will never repeat again, is a realization I hold close to my heart. It is a grounding notion as someone who comes and goes from my homeland, finding souvenirs in fleeting moments.’?

In the wake of sakura season’s transience, journalist and author Akiko Kurematsu (@akikokurematsu) is accompanied by photographer Martin Bruno (@martinbrunophoto) to @Aman_Tokyo as she finds herself reconnecting with her Japanese heritage, its rituals and nuances in a way that brings fresh perspective on both this ancient culture and her own sense of self.

Read the full story via the link in bio.

No visit to Japan is ever complete without spotting the ubiquitous "maneki-neko" or beckoning cat.  Nestled within the neighbouring Setagaya ward of Tokyo is Gotokuji Temple, a Buddhist temple that is said to be the birthplace of the maneki-neko, or “luck-inviting cat figurine". Hundreds, if not thousands of cat figurines line the temple grounds and guests can purchase traditional "omikuji" or fortunes.

We are delighted to collaborate once again with father-and-son Japanese artisans Mr. Shoryu and Mr. Yoho Hatoba on our latest Autumn Kamon artwork, “The Peninsula + Kaede + Art.” Kamon is the traditional art form of family crests, representing heritage, identity, and artistry. Each intricate kamon design tells a story, blending history with craftsmanship. Inspired by the Japanese word “kaede” meaning “maple leaf,” this installation features our hotel’s original emblem set against a stunning national treasure painting from 1592.

Blending traditional Kamon art with modern digital printing technology, this spectacular piece stretches 7 meters high by 11 meters wide (23 feet x 36 feet) and is printed on 112 strips of Japanese washi paper.

Stepping out of Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi, you’ll find yourself in the heart of the capital’s history and hustle at Tokyo Station. Opened in 1914, this architectural gem just minutes' walk from the hotel has seen Japan's evolution, from steam engines to Shinkansen. Whether you’re catching a train or just soaking in the century-old charm, Tokyo Station is your gateway to an adventure.

And so the blossoms fall, and so my days …” 
- Onitsura

Sakura season in Japan. Clouds of cherry blossom from deep blush and powder pink to soft white spring into life across the country. The practice of hanami (‘flower viewing’) brings friends and families together for picnics and celebrations beneath these delicate canopies to honour their beauty and the coming of spring. An epic sight to behold, venture out from @Aman_Tokyo to experience first-hand the wonder and fragility of this season, believed to symbolise the ephemeral nature of life itself.

#TheSpiritofAman #Tokyo #Japan

Celebrating one of the most beloved flavours of the season, the Lounge by Aman presents  a trio of cocktails showcasing Japanese strawberry. One of nature’s greatest delicacies is highlighted in a special tribute at @Aman_Tokyo’s Arva this month. The White Truffle Fair celebrates this highly prized and richly flavoured ingredient, sourced in the Italian Piedmont region, with a menu that showcases its inimitable flavour. From Castelmagno cheese risotto to Kagoshimi Ibusuki waygu sirlon and porcini mushrooms, dishes are showered at the table with white truffle shavings to add a truly delicious note of fragrant opulence.

In the towering heights of @Aman_Tokyo, the Misogi Retreat delves deep to deliver a sense of profound physical and spiritual transformation. This unique programme combines ancient practises with healthy nutrition over the course of the three-night stay. Including yoga, acupuncture and sword training along with Kodo Zen incense meditation, a tea ceremony and a Traditional Chinese Medicine consultation, the retreat culminates in an Ogoma Ritual at a temple for purification, inviting a longer, healthier, more spiritually enriching life.

Starting with a foot ritual, it involves a deep body massage using hot stones. Available from September 23 to November 30.

It’s all about Champagne at Bistronomy “Towers” on March 10 – with a special Champagne pairing dinner. Five prestige Champagnes from Telmont will be expertly paired with a delicious seasonal French menu created by chef de cuisine Takuji Nakano. A highlight? The main dish of roasted pigeon with liver sauce paired with Blanc de Blanc Vinothèque 2005, an exclusive prestige cuvée from Telmont. The Capitol Hotel Tokyu Associates ? 
Takayuki Yamahashi: Chef of the Chinese Restaurant Star Hill 
?
"My early twenties were spent thoroughly studying authentic Chinese cuisine in China, which serves as the foundation of my cooking. I cherish the vast and profound traditions of Chinese cuisine while also integrating the knowledge and techniques I learned from the chefs of Japanese and Western cuisines at this hotel. 
?
I believe in allowing the ingredients to shine without excessive manipulation, ensuring each dish is both simple in presentation yet crafted with care and skill. 
My goal is for 'Star Hill' to be synonymous with Chinese cuisine, and I hope to pass on my techniques and passion to the next generation." 
?
Starting his culinary journey at the age of six, Chef Yamahashi aspired to become a chef from an early age. With nearly 30 years of experience in the world of Chinese cuisine, he has become a leading figure in the field.

… Hie-jinja Shrine ??
Just 2 minutes from the hotel, Hie Shrine is well-known in Tokyo as one of the most spiritual places in the capital. Many people visit to pray for protection, marriage, childbirth and toward off evil. The #SannoFestival, known as one of the three major festivals in Japan and the biggest of the three major festivals in Edo, is held every June. Though it's located in the centre of the city, the Hie shrine has a rich forest area, which we highly recommend as a walk to take for some quiet in the hustle & bustle of Tokyo during your stay at the hotel!

Imperial Connections

Hamarikyu Gardens became an imperial villa after the Meiji Restoration. Today it offers a peaceful escape in the city. A beautiful oasis flanked by impressive glass and steel towers.

You can enjoy this tranquil escape in the city from 9 am until 5 pm each day.

Just a short distance from the hotel: 1-1 Hamarikyu Garden, Chuo-ku 
Opening hours: 9 am - 5 pm (admission until 4.30 pm). 

From mid-May to late September 2024, restoration work will be carried out. Please check before visiting the park.

Today is Tanabata, also known as the Star Festival, a Japanese festival originating from the Chinese Qixi Festival. It celebrates the meeting of the deities Orihime and Hikoboshi who, according to legend, are separated by the Milky Way and meet only once on the seventh day of the seventh lunar month of the lunisolar calendar. We wish you a happy and enjoyable summer!

Sustainable Tourism Japan: Deep and authentic cultural experiences in Tokyo

Ensconced in our hyper-modern metropolis are vestiges of ancient Japan that travellers often overlook.
For those eager to dive deeper into Japanese culture, Mytaiken unveils the mystery of one of the world's oldest surviving forms of theatre: Noh.
Designated as an Intangible Cultural Heritage by UNESCO, Noh Theatre is adapted from Japanese traditional literature and was originally performed for the shogun and nobility as early as the 14th century.

In a 90-minute session in central Tokyo, practising Noh masters provide an introduction to the origins and meaning of Noh, along with a private demonstration.
Support the preservation of Japan’s cultural heritage by including this experience in your itinerary. 

Contact Mytaiken for more information.?https://my-taiken.com/

#SustainableTourismJapan #AuthenticTokyo #JapaneseCulture #MyTaiken #ExploreTokyo #VisitJapan #TokyoExperiences #TokyoNohExperience #Shogun #TheCapitolHotelTokyu

Art That Tells a Story

The "Yadoya" signboard, was hand-carved by the renowned gastronomist Kitaoji Rosanjin.

From the late Taisho era to the early Showa era, Rosanjin's members-only restaurant, Hoshioka(Star Hill) Saryo, thrived as a gathering place for influential figures in politics and business.

Immerse yourself in this rich history and the beautiful artwork that encapsulates the hotel's story.

A smile that lights up your arrival! The Peninsula Tokyo embodies the true spirit of hospitality, making each of our guests feel cherished in their own home away from home.

Taking their design cues from the interiors of traditional Japanese houses, the guestrooms of Aman Tokyo are crafted from natural materials: wood, stone and Japanese paper. Deep granite bathtubs invite skyline-view soaking, with floor-to-ceiling windows onto the dynamic drama of the cityscape, abuzz by day, glittering by night.

Sanno Matsuri - 7th June 

The Sanno Matsuri Grand Parade takes place every even-numbered year in June. We're honoured to host the mikoshi bearers before they tackle the climb up Otokozaka (the steep steps up to the temple). 

Step into our main lobby during the festival and you’ll enjoy a beautiful Mikoshi shrine display along with the heroic sounds of Sanno Matsuri

World Environment Day and World Oceans Day

Every sunset is a reminder of life's beauty and a moment to pause before Tokyo's busy nightlife starts.

The interplay of light and shade is at the root of all Japanese aesthetics, and underpins the visual and textural experience of Aman Tokyo. Serenity in the heart of the city

Hamarikyu Gardens is a representative Daimyo garden of the Edo period. It features the only seawater pond in Tokyo with water straight from Tokyo Bay. The natural beauty of the park, with its teahouses and duck pond provides a dramatic contrast to the skyscrapers that surround it.

Just a short distance from the hotel. 
Opening Hours:9 a.m. to 5 p.m.(admission until 4:30 p.m.)

Art from the past and the present

Leading abstract Ink painter Toko Shinoda created one of the iconic artworks in the former hotel. When the Beatles stayed at the hotel in 1966, they were so taken by the work they purchased a brush identical to the one used to create it. For The Capitol Hotel Tokyu's opening in 2010, Toko Shinoda created a new work. Today they’re displayed as a pair, symbolising the connection between the history of the hotel; old and new.

Explore Tokyo like a local, on two wheels For travellers eager to see “real” Tokyo life, Dig Tokyo Tours offer unique, socially responsible and immersive experiences in the captivating local neighbourhoods on Tokyo’s inner west-side. The flagship experience involves cycling on a salvaged Japanese 'mamachari' bicycle to take in the sights and sounds of Koenji, Nakano and Asagaya. Guests can also experience a 'salaryman' style lunch and a variety of downtown Tokyo street food bites. Using their local knowledge, the tour is private or small group to ensure an intimate and low-impact cycling experience away from the tourist crowds. For more information please visit:https://www.digtokyotours.com/

Executive Chef Toshinori Sogabe

Our Executive Chef Sogabe embodies our passion for food. Creative and innovative, Sogabe explores new culinary horizons as he inspires the hotel's restaurant and banqueting staff.

#TheCapitolHotelTokyu #LuxuryCapitolHotel #CapitolHotel #CapitolTokyuHotel #VisitJapan #LuxuryTokyo #LuxuryJapan  #TokyoFoodie #TokyoCuisine
#ThePreferredLife #BelieveInTravel #IPreferRewards

At Aman Tokyo, Arva celebrates New Year’s Eve with a ‘Cenone’ – a grand Italian feast – themed around gold. Chef Masakazu Hiraki’s eight courses conjure the authentic tastes of Italy from hand-selected Japanese ingredients, with dishes such as the much-loved sea urchin pasta, and Hokkaido horsehair crab risotto featuring Italian rice grown from seedlings in Yamanashi rice fields and harvested especially for this day. After a dinner serandaded by Japanese classical musicians, the celebrations continue at the Lounge by Aman, where the countdown to 2023 begins…

Introducing Aman Essential Skin. @Aman’s new range of ultra-efficient, functional skincare developed and produced in Japan. 
 
Grown from the brand’s distinctly Asian roots, Aman Essential Skin features two of Japan's most salient skincare ingredients, rice bran and indigo extract, as well as skin actives including Vitamin C, Vitamin E, peptides, and hyaluronic acid. 
 
Designed to streamline the process of daily skin protection, five new formulas combine to create an effective skincare routine, supporting the natural skin barrier, encouraging deep hydration, and protecting from environmental stressors. 
 
Aman Essential Skin is available now via the link in bio.

Nihonbashi is Tokyo’s artisan quarter, a nighbourhood where many of Japan’s historic crafts have been preserved and passed down since the Edo period. Traditionally catering to the actors and geishas that worked in Shintomi-cho, Oonoya Sohonten sells uniquely developed Shintomi-style Tabi shoes. Foot patterns and iron moulds fill the cultural heritage-listed store, where guests are invited to observe the craftsmen as the cut and sew while the store's seventh generation owner offers an insight into the company's history.?

MOMAT is staging a special exhibition featuring carefully chosen ‘art Trios’ from Paris, Tokyo and Osaka.

Classic French baking, but with a Japanese twist. This is the philosophy that lies at the heart of @Aman_Tokyo’s La Pâtisserie, a dining experience in pastry excellence that is celebrating its one-year anniversary. Masterminded by Executive Pastry Chef, Yoshihisa Miyagawa, each creation is meticulously crafted. Delicate and delicious Mille Feuille Framboise to sumptuous Baba a l’Armagnac, served in a light-filled space within the Otemachi Tower, merging contemporary design with the sensibility of a classic culinary reimagined for the modern day. Here’s to many more years to come.?
?

The menu at Arva takes on a flavour of celebration over the festive period, with an array of dishes developed especially for the season. Chef Masakazu Hiraki has bought his expertise in Italian cuisine to bear on the finest ingredients available in Japan, such as longtooth grouper from the Goto Islands, which Chef Hiraki visited this summer. Featuring dishes such as roasted wagyu fillet made with rare Kagoshima Ibusuki beef and fragrant black truffle, the menu is characterised by both simplicity and sophistication.

Spring Festival at the National Museum of Modern Art

MOMAT’s “Spring Festival” is held every year to mark the arrival of the cherry blossom. Enjoy Kawai Gyokudo’s 'Parting Spring', a masterpiece depicting cherry blossoms falling on water. Also on view will be Kikuchi Hobun’s Fine Rain on Mt. Yoshino as well as spring works by contemporary artists Kodama Yasue and Hidaka Rieko.
 
MOMAT, just one of the great attractions you can enjoy a short distance from our hotel.

From the heights of the Otemachi Tower, Aman Tokyo surveys the cityscape – a grand urban spectacle afloat in a sea of greenery. The endless possibilities of the Japanese capital are spread out below, while indoors, the Aman Spa –Tokyo’s largest – and a 30m swimming pool offer the perfect antidote to days spent discovering the secrets of the city.?

This month, The Lounge by Aman transforms memories of summer on the coast into delicate and dainty sweets. At the top, a yacht crafted from brown sugar chocolate cream squeezed into passion tart and finished with mango and white chocolate, together with a praline-ring shoe. In the middle, a handbag of raspberry and strawberry buttercream sand; a citron decorated with shells, a mango mousse with a mosquito-repellent coil motif, and a Kyoho grape and cassis tart made with cream cheese. At the base of the tray, a mosaic of salmon and sea bream with salted kelp; grilled camembert; pondequejo bread shaped like summer oranges, and scallop and white fish part-filo. Cool basil mousse and a fishbowl of vegetable jelly is served with butterfly pea.?
?
Book afternoon tea at Aman Tokyo via the link in bio.?

A space of reflection and communion, guests can observe the changing of the seasons with the feeling of harmonious contentment as night turns to day, and winter turns to spring.?

In the soaring heights of the Otemachi Tower, Chef Masakazu Hiraki brings his 17 years of experience in celebrated kitchens across Venice to @Aman_Tokyo’s Arva. This is where Chef Masakazu creates his own unique brand of gastronomic magic, merging his extensive knowledge of Italian ingredients and techniques with a Japanese understanding of clean, classic flavours. Aman Tokyo’s Arva is a meeting of two worlds, where one extraordinary culinary heritage is influenced by another to deliver a truly unique dining experience.?
?
Discover dining at #AmanTokyo via the link in bio.?
?
#AmanResorts #OtemachiTower #Tokyo #Japan

Arva's summer menu brings a rainbow of summer vegetables and seasonal ingredients to the plate. Combining chilled veal with tuna, the Piedmontese dish Vitello Tonnato is a fresh and flavoursome appetiser, whearas Ravioli Carbonara draws on the delicious richness of Japanese unagi. Summer highlights include Fritto di Murena Giapponese, tempering the flavour of pike conger with balsamic vinegar, and Spaghettini Freddo – chilled spaghettini with delicate Ise tuna.?

Luxury with a View of The City
 
Indulge in the ultimate luxury experience by staying in the hotel's Deluxe King room. The room’s contemporary design with its bird’s eye view of Tokyo's magnificent cityscape, including the iconic National Diet Building makes a stay to remember.
 
If you're in search of a tranquil ambience to unwind and enjoy a drink, The Capitol Bar is the perfect spot. The bar offers a serene atmosphere with awe-inspiring views of the lush greenery in the gardens, creating a harmonious balance between nature and the city of Akasaka.
 
For more information, please visit @thecapitolhoteltokyu's profile link

5 Stars from The Forbes Travel Guide

The world-renowned Forbes Travel Guide has again awarded The Capitol Hotel Tokyu its highest 5-star rating.

Founded in the United States in 1958, The Forbes Travel Guide is an organisation that sets the standards of excellent hospitality around the world.

This year, just 13 hotels were rated as 5 star in Japan, with 9 of them located in Tokyo. 

We thank all our guests for their support this year and look forward to welcoming you with our omotenashi hospitality in 2024.

Strawberries to Delight

Indulge in the luxurious ORIGAMI Strawberry Parfait, made with seasonal strawberries and layered with berries, strawberry sauce, and fresh cream. This perfect blend of sweet, sour, and salty flavours is topped with yoghurt Espuma and Parmesan Tuile. 

Indulge your taste buds with this delicious dessert, available until Sunday, March 31st. For more information, please visit @thecapitolhoteltokyu's profile link

Museum of Modern Art - Special Exhibition

MOMAT is staging the first major retrospective in nearly twenty years of legendary photographer Nakahira Takuma. The exhibition will include Takuma's iconic work 'Overflow' (1974). The work consists of 48 colour photographs arranged on a wall 6 meters wide. MOMAT is one of the wonderful experiences you can enjoy just a short distance from our hotel. Nakahira Takuma: Burn-Overflow is on from Feb 6 – April 7, 2024 at the Special Exhibition Gallery (1st floor).?

Nakahira Takuma, overflow, 1974 The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo ©Gen Nakahira
