Chef Masakazu Hiraki has honed his craft over 17 years in the kitchens of Italy, and channels his profound affinity with Italian culinary heritage into bespoke menus tailored to the guest and the event.?

For this year’s Christmas's dinner, Chef Hiraki keeps his focus local, looking to the finest Japanese ingredients available this season to create dishes of great delicacy and depth of flavour. His menu for Arva includes scallops from the northern shores, paired with marinated red cabbage; home-made turmeric gnocchi with Ibaraki duck; and porcini ragout with black truffle. The centrepiece – beef fillet slow cooked with winter vegetables – is an indulgent festive delight.?

Off the coast of Kyushu in the East China Sea, the Goto Islands are renowned for fresh marine  produce, including a wealth of exquisite seafood and their signature camellia oil. For Head Chef Hiraki, visits to Goto take him back to the years he spent living and cooking on the islands of Italy, and the extraordinary flavours he found there.?
?
From 18 August to 5 September, Chef Hiraki invites Arva diners to join him on a journet through his culinary memories, as he combines the ingredients of the Goto Islands with the traditional Italian cooking methods he loves, bringing out the distinctive flavours of this exceptional produce in dishes such as 'Risotto di Ago’, topped with dried Ago (flying fish) and finished with Goto soy sauce, made from rice malt and camellia yeast.?
?

The sweet aroma of white truffles from Piedmont is used to enhance dishes such as Parmigiano Reggiano risotto, the chef's favourite raviolone, and a magnificent pork cotoletta, known for its delicate texture and sweetness. To reveal the freshest and most mellow fragrance, the Arva team will slice the truffle and finish each dish at the table.?

This autumn, Aman Tokyo invites guests to immerse themselves in the unique culture and history of the surrounding city. The hotel’s home in Tokyo’s Marunouchi and Otemachi area, was once the heart of Edo, the city seat of the Tokugawa shogunate in the 17th century. Today, Aman Tokyo can arrange chauffeured tours of the surrounding city, discover the remnants of the city’s Edo-period heritage, as well as historic craft stores where the ancient arts of lacquer making, fan folding, and Japanese paper making are preserved. Follow the link in bio to discover more.?

Our New Year Ikebana Decoration

Ikebana is the traditional art of Japanese flower arranging. 

Our January ikebana includes a red bamboo belt with soft loops to symbolise the desire for everlasting joy and happiness. The contrast between the red and white bamboo and the driftwood at the centre, makes the greenery of the pine and camellia stand out. 

The blooming buds of the Ume flowers bring further pleasure into the New Year ??

A Delicious Start to The New Year
Our special New Year Parfait bursts with flavour and colour. Japanese-inspired, this very special parfait is adorned with red and white mochi balls and Mizuhiki, a traditional decorative cord.
Enjoy a perfect balance of flavours with fruit and agar underneath the lightly whipped cream, sweet adzuki beans, and brown sugar syrup - but don’t delay, our special New Year Parfait is only available until 14th January.
 
For more information, please visit @thecapitolhoteltokyu's profile link.

Happy New Year? 

At New Year it’s tradition to visit one of Japan’s many Shrines. 

At The Capitol Hotel Tokyu, we’re fortunate to have one of Tokyo’s most significant shrines just a short walk away. The Hie Shrine is a popular destination for New Year's visits due to its great historical and spiritual significance. ?Immerse yourself in Japanese culture when you visit us.

We wish you a happy and prosperous year ahead.

Original Goshuincho???

Goshuincho is an "honourable stamp book" for those visiting shrines or temples. 
The Capitol Tokyu Hotel has a unique Goshuincho popular with many who visit the Hie Shrine close to the hotel.

The history of the Hie Shrine stretches back nearly 600 years. The birthplace of the Shogun's family during the Edo period, the shrine is now revered as the guardian deity of the Imperial Palace.

Our guests often visit the shrine when celebrating weddings and bringing families together for special occasions. The Capitol Hotel Tokyu's originally designed Goshuincho was first created to help mark these special moments.

Available for purchase at the Business Centre on the 3rd floor. How about starting the year with a fresh start with a new Goshuincho?

The Daruma doll symbolises good fortune and good luck. Our New Year's Daruma cake has a smooth, rich cream cheese, layered with orange marmalade, and coated with caramel-flavoured glaze.

You can also choose from a variety of expressions on your "Daruma" cakes' face. 

Available from January 1st to 11th at the Lounge "ORIGAMI" on the 3rd floor.

Christmas Made Extra Special - Sunday 17th December

The Capitol Tokyu Hotel is special for many reasons. 
Its location, close to The Imperial Palace, was once the home to the exclusive member’s restaurant Hoshioka Saryo, presided over by renowned gastronomist Kitaoji Rosanjin. His dedication to food and hospitality live on in our hotel today.

Our Sanno no Mori Gastronomic Club continues this tradition. Executive Chef Toshinori Sogabe has created a truly memorable and luxurious French dining experience with truffles used in all dishes; from the aperitif to dessert. Indulge yourself.

For more information and reservations, please check the link in our bio: @thecapitolhoteltokyu

Autumn foliage has arrived in Tokyo, bringing vibrant colours to the city day by day. At The Capitol Hotel Tokyu, visitors can immerse themselves in the serene beauty of the trees surrounding the nearby Imperial Palace and Hie Shrine – a site revered as one of Tokyo's most powerful and sacred – while enjoying the convenience of being located in the vibrant heart of the Japanese capital. The area surrounding the hotel provides the ideal setting for jogging and leisurely walks, allowing guests to fully embrace the seasonal splendour of this remarkable city. Come and indulge in a moment of pure serenity at The Capitol Hotel Tokyu.

With only two months left in 2023 and the holiday season fast approaching, we’d like to introduce you to the festive flavour of Stollen – a traditional German Christmas treat made with nuts, spices and candied fruit. Traditionally eaten in the four weeks running up to Christmas, our stollen has a rich, mature flavour, with plenty of Negrita rum, raisins and mixed fruits soaked in brandy for over a year. After baking, our deliciously moist stollen – matured over four months to achieve a deep mellow taste and aroma – is dipped in clarified butter and coated with fragrant vanilla sugar for that decadent finishing touch. No Christmas would be complete without stollen – so complete yours with our special taste of the season.

Iconic Japanese architect Kengo Kuma designed our hotel entrance to evoke a "sense of arrival". The "Shiraki" wooden eaves visually express the Japanese tradition of greeting visitors, directing them to the main entrance in an approach similar to that of a shrine. The wood creates a sense of unity with the forest of the adjacent Hie Shrine to give customers a deep feeling of welcome.

Beautiful Days start with Breakfast

The Capitol Hotel Tokyu is renowned for many things - a great location, wonderful service and, of course, its authentic Japanese breakfast. 
 
Our Japanese Restaurant “Suiren” is where our skilled chefs create the array of small bowls filled with savoury dishes and appetisers featuring the finest seafood and mountain delights.
 
Choose between grilled salmon or sea bream as your main dish and savour the renowned 'dashi maki tamago' (Japanese omelette) seasoned with dashi, a unique Japanese soup stock.
 
Start the day in the best way possible with breakfast at The Capitol Hotel Tokyu.

For more details, please check the link in our bio: @thecapitolhoteltokyu

Our Chinese Restaurant ”Star Hill" serves superior Chinese cuisine in a chic, modern dining space. There are also 7 private rooms of various sizes which are perfect for business or celebratory occasions, such as the spacious private room "Raku-en" and "Raku-fu" from which guests can look out over the garden lined with red pine trees.

One of our most popular courses at our Chinese Restaurant Star Hill is the 'Special Treat' buffet style menu, which can be enjoyed on Saturdays, Sundays, and on holidays. You can choose from 120 menu items made with love and care by our expert team in the kitchen, so you're free to create your own courses with all your favourite foods and styles of cooking available, or try those dishes you'd always wanted to taste. This menu is perfect to be enjoyed on special occasions with family or friends, which is why we've name it the Special Treat menu - we think that it's certainly deserving of the name!

Every few months our renowned Chinese Restaurant "Star Hill" selects a Japanese prefecture to be its inspiration and theme for a limited period of time, where our head chef will visit the region to handpick seasonal speciality ingredients to use in dishes during the restaurant's Food Fair event.

For their upcoming event which begins on the 1st February, ingredients will be brought from #AkitaPrefecture in the northern Japan, the prefecture's debut as the star of our specials available during the event! The event promises to serve a luxurious course of dishes, where you can enjoy the unique taste of Chinese cuisine with Japanese ingredients carefully selected by the chef himself. 

We thought you'd enjoy a taster of what's to come, so for dessert, we will be serving a dish inspired by the Kogetsu Pond of Senshu Park, Akita City, which won the Japan Tourism Agency Commissioner's Award in the dessert category of the All Japanese-Chinese Cuisine contest last year. 

Explore Japan with your tastebuds, and discover the charm of Akita Prefecture through these exceptional dishes.

The Capitol Beef Bowl served at the All Day Dining "ORIGAMI", is a gem for those who are in the know!

With quality beef as the star of the show, we are particular about using only meat and onions in this dish, so that you can enjoy the taste of the meat to the fullest. All that's left to add is our ORIGAMI Special Warishita sause, which has been perfected over the years to act as subtle companion and bring out the umami flavour even more. Sometimes simplicity is all you need to let the quality ingredients speak for themselves - just one taste and you'll understand how luxurious this dish truly is.

Our special banquet event Sustainable Table, which has been held three times since 2022, will reach its final chapter on February 18th. Our first event explored the theme of plant-based food, our second chapter focussed on Food loss and waste, and for our third event, we looked at the world of “Sustainable Seafood & Better Meat”. For our fourth and final instalment, our theme is “Well-Being”. Mr. Hitoshi Sugiura, advisory chef of the Japan Sustainable Restaurant Association, and our hotel's executive chef, Toshinori Sogabe, will team up once more to deliver a limited special dinner course for one day only, to show that exquisite, fine dining dishes can be sustainable!

Introducing our special lunch event "The Art of Food - Spring Dining Table"

Celebrating the meeting point of art and food culture, we are hosting a lunch event, "Art of Food - Spring dining table" on 25th February! 

At this special event, we will be seving an exquisite meal in collaboration with the British ceramicist and fine chine manufacturer WEDGWOOD @wedgwoodjapan in "The Capitol Suite", our signature suite at the hotel. You'll be taken on a spring tour of food and art, enjoying the fine cuisine we have at The Capitol Hotel Tokyu, and fine new pieces of chinaware from WEDGWOOD. 

This event promises to be a luxury experience for all senses, in every sense of the word.

Thank you for your continued patronage of The Capitol Hotel Tokyu. We received the highest Five-Star rating in the Hotel Category for 2023 by the world-renowned 'Forbes Travel Guide' following last year.

Founded in the United States in 1958, The Forbes Travel Guide is an organisation that sets the standards of excellent hospitality around the world and announces the prestigious Five-Star rating. In this year, 14 hotels were rated as 5 star in Japan and ten of them are located in Tokyo. The Capitol Hotel Tokyu promises comfortable omotenashi hospitality to all of our customers as a 5 star hotel, and we look forward to serving you more now than ever before.

Ahead of the upcoming traditional Japanese festival day #Setsubun on February 3rd, our luxurious new Setsubun “Fukumame” sweets will be available from 15th January! 

Literally meaning "seasonal division" in Japanese, Setsubun is a festival held on the day before the beginning of Spring according to the Japanese lunar calendar. A common tradition of the festival is mamemaki, where roasted soybeans are thrown out from your doorstep to drive away evil spirits and welcome good fortune to your door for the year.

To celebrate the day, we've made fukumame, fragrantly caramelized hazelnuts coated with blonde chocolate and powdered sugar, and generously served in the hotel's original masu cup complete with a demon mask made of chocolate to play the evil spirits of Setsubun! After throwing the beans, it's customary to eat as many beans as your age to ward off evil - so why not enjoy our delicious fukumame made by our skilled pastry chefs this year to welcome Spring!

We're all wishing for a great year ahead, and you're in luck as the traditional King Cake, which is said to bring good fortune, will be available for a limited time from December 30th to January 14th!

The King Cake is a beloved traditional confectionery cake that is eaten during the French New Year. It’s said to “bring luck for the coming year” to the person who finds a small ceramic doll inside. But even if that isn't you, you'll still feel pretty lucky when enjoying the texture and fragrant flavour of the pie which is made from carefully made puff pastry, and infused with almonds for a luxurious flavour. This cake is perfect for your New Year’s party to look ahead to 2023! ??

Our fried chicken, which can be enjoyed at All Day Dining "ORIGAMI", or through room service in a guest room, as well as at The Capitol Bar, has a light batter and a crispy texture, with a tender, well seasoned chicken. You can even enjoy it in the origami swan-shaped bowl, to bring that added delicate touch to this delicious favourite!

Being away from home might mean you miss some of your usual meals, but our signature #GermanApplePancake will certainly help to ease the yearning for those home comforts.

This huge pancake-like dish is a popular choice at the hotel, and it's easy to see why. Baked in a frying pan with fresh apples and a chewy dough that is kneaded and beaten over and over again, you might not know that the head chef of the previous hotel that sat at this site, the Tokyo Hilton Hotel, inherited and developed this traditional recipe inspired by the pancakes his German grandmother made. 

We hope you'll enjoy these sweet, tasty masterpieces that will remind you of the finest homecooking.

The legendary Keyaki Grill is sure to bring the festive cheer to your holy night again this year!

The Keyaki Grill, which once stood in the main dining room of the former Capitol Tokyu Hotel, will return on Christmas Eve this year after the great success of last Christmas. Inspired by the theme of truffle this year, executive chef Toshinori Sokabe will create a series of splendid courses to make your Christmas Eve unforgettable. 

This year we will also welcome the former maître de d'hôtel, who welcomed many customers to the historic Keyaki Grill, and the former pianist who once serenaded this famous restaurant to create the same magical atmosphere that The Keyaki Grill was celebrated for! 

Enjoy a luxurious experience this Christmas with this special occasion which is here for one night only!

Inspired by Culture Day, a national holiday in Japan, we're delighted to introduce this beautiful work of art, which follow's the holiday theme this year of 'love, freedom and peace, and letting our culture flourish'. 

Until she passed away in March last year at the age of 107, Japanese artist #TokoShinoda passionately created abstract ink paintings. Her work, which is characterized by a free style not bound by the dichotomy of calligraphy and painting, characters and figures, is displayed in key locations around the hotel, including the suite rooms and our Japanese Restaurant "Suiren". Additionally, her work "Yutaka", which is displayed in the lobby, is an original created for when the hotel opened 12 years ago to welcome our guests with her delicate, yet bold, and free form style.

Our Lemon Baumkuchen, with its sweet tanginess from fresh Sicilian lemons, has been one of the most popular items at our Pastry Boutique "ORIGAMI". Now it's getting cooler outside, this refreshing treat is also a brilliant partner for a coffee. And with our individually wrapped slices, you can now enjoy a little luxury to takeaway with a coffee on the go!

Attention foodies: The best time of year to enjoy the Japan's crab cuisine is just around the corner!

Every few months our Chinese Restaurant ”Star Hill selects a Japanese prefecture as a limited period theme, and our head chef visits the region to handpick specialty, seasonal ingredients to use in dishes during the restaurant's Food Fair event. 

For their upcoming event beginning 8th November, ingredients will be brought from Kanazawa, Ishikawa Prefecture to feature in all the specials available!

Kanazawa's winter big hitters are ready to take centre stage on our special menu, with Kobako Crab, Kano Crab, Red Horsehead fish and premium Noto Pork. 

To fully enjoy the taste of Kanazawa while staying in Tokyo, the menu will be changed halfway through the event period so that you can enjoy all the amazing seasonal flavours of the prefecture. 

Explore the food of Kanazawa, a beautiful castle town with over 400 years of history, with this luxurious menu combining Japanese cuisine with Chinese cooking techniques at Star Hill. 

__________________

"Kanawa Food Fair 2022" 
First menu: 8th November to 30th December 
Second menu: 10th January to 31st January 
*only available on weekdays

**For inquiries and reservations, please check the link in our bio @thecapitolhoteltokyu .

Following the traditional methods of Japanese architecture, our guest rooms are designed for ease of moving around, making every stay that little bit more comfortable for you. Our rooms aren't only beautiful, they're functional too - you'll find Shoji, a traditional Japanese paper screen, in your room to help separate and create more space to enjoy your stay with us at The Capitol Hotel Tokyu.

Time flies so fast, we can't believe there are just two months left in 2022! Have you got plans for Christmas? If you're still deciding, why not let us deck the halls for you this year!

You can choose from two Christmas plans this year. In the Christmas Flower Box Plan, we'll bring you the hotel's handmade, original Christmas flower arrangement inspired by the theme of Authentic Christmas, which will certainly add a little festive cheer. 

Or, with our In room Dinner & Champagne Plan, you can enjoy a special dinner in a private room along with a celebratory half bottle of champagne, as well as a dessert cake and  Christmas flower box, to make Christmas an unforgettable evening.

Both plans also include a guest room offer with a six metre wide window to enjoy a beautiful view of the Tokyo skyline just for you. The room is also available until checkout at 3pm so you can enjoy your morning and breakfast without having to rush. 

Come and celebrate this holy night with The Capitol Hotel Tokyu. 

**For inquiries and reservations, please message us via DM.

The delicious Tiramisu Parfait is our next seasonal parfait available in our Lounge "ORIGAMI".
 
Layers of rich cocoa cookies with sweet, fresh mascarpone make this parfait a work of art in its tall glass, served with fresh fruit and chocolate ice cream that compliment the bitterness of the cocoa to add that extra sweetness to this tasty dessert. 

Available from 1st to 30th November & 26th to 31st December
